title: Agricultural Supply and Harvest Collection Optimization
desc_split: A farming cooperative must deliver fertilizers, seeds, and equipment (<demand_linehaul>) to scattered farms (<loc_customer>) while also collecting harvested crops (<demand_backhaul>) from the same locations. Trucks depart from the central supply depot (<loc_depot>) and can alternate between deliveries and pickups in any sequence to maximize efficiency. Each vehicle has a strict capacity (<capacity>), requiring careful planning to avoid overloading while ensuring all farms are serviced. The goal is to minimize total travel distance, with trucks ending their routes at their final stop rather than returning to the depot.
label: ovrpmb
